TopicTitle: Updated BrickMod to work with new KSP

Articles.Content:
Download it @ KerbalSpacePort

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

UPDATED 10.10.13

New parts:

wings

beams

slopes

bricks

docking port

lights

canopy

command module

and more!

Let me know what you think of how the new parts are built and if you have any suggestions for configuring them.

Enjoy!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Found an outdated mod by keptin thread: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/2503-v0-6-BrickMod?p=184729&viewfull=1#post184729 And updated to work with new KSP versions.

Includes:

2 Standard Liquid Engine Bricks

1 miniLiquid Engine Brick

1 Radial Liquid Engine Brick

1 Ion Engine Brick

1 Xenon Fuel Tank

1 RCS Fuel Tank Brick

1 RCS Thruster Port Brick

3 Liquid Fuel Tank Bricks

1 Stack Decoupler Brick

1 SAS Brick

1 PowerCell Brick

1 Winglet Brick

2 Radial Decoupler Bricks

1 Solid Booster Brick

1 Command Pod Brick (unfortunately hatch isnt working, so no EVA)

2 Nosecone Bricks

A few more screenshots

Installation:

Extract the BrickMod folder into the GameData directory

Usage:

Use the added "LEGO" style bricks to start building "LEGO" style rockets! There's not much too it, basically a few standard parts with "LEGO" style mesh and skin.

License:

http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/deed.en_US

Update 25.9.2013

Some screen shots of the work in progress.

http://imgur.com/a/o56hr

Edited March 24, 2014 by Roboto

Okay, I checked out the old thread and his download file (form here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/2503)

And I see no license ever posted by that author, or permission to redistribute.

So, did you contact keptin to get permission?

Over a year ago he made this post: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/2503-v0-6-BrickMod?p=184729&viewfull=1#post184729

He definitely was looking for someone to take over, but it clearly states you do need to contact him for permission to take over.

You can't just take his mod and apply your own license to it. If you do get permission, it might not be a bad idea to throw some credit back to the original author as well.

Unrelated note: you should also put a copy of your license in your download (once its compliant)

My apologies upfront for going about this incorrectly. I'm sorta new to the process and just copied a license to satisfy the forum rules, it wasn't my intention to take any credit for the original work. That said, I actually don't remember seeing that post by keptin, I found the mod in google posted on a different site. But I will contact him about it though, it's only right that I do.

Edited September 17, 2013 by Roboto
spelling
Great, I hope you can get in touch with him

Hey, sweet! thanks!

Oops, I gave you the older version of the license, the 3.0 link is in keptin's post now, you should probably use that one.

And let me know if you need any help.
If the craft crashes, is there a sound of the plastic bricks smashing?
My 5 and 6 year old just had a lively debate on how a Kerbal gets inside a pod with no doors, then they went and actually built some rockets with their Legos.
I've always been describing KSP as "Lego rockets that blow up", now it can literally be that!

Just saw this post....oh dear god http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/20455-should-i-redo-the-lego-mod
I never got very far with anything, mainly because i wanted to completely remake it with more parts and stuff, but i couldn't and still, have no idea how to use unity, but good luck with it!

Make sure to not step on any of the pieces....

You Dad's out there can concur, the love of Lego's drops a few notches when you step on one at 6AM with a hangover

All new parts have been added!

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/brickmod-revived/

Okay I don't want to cause any problems here, but I have to ask this question. Did you get permission from LEGO to develop this mod? I ask this not to cause a problem, but because the LEGO is a copyrighted brand and without the proper permissions from the makers of LEGO, you could run into a whole heap of legal problems. I'm not totally familiar with the legal details of using copyrighted work in a mod like this and for all I know it might not be a problem, but I would strongly recommend contacting the LEGO and explain what you are doing and find out if it's a problem or not. Else contact Squad about this mod and ask their legal department what the general rules are about something like this.
Just remove all mention of lego and you are fine
You really had to bump a 3 month old post to ask about legal stuff ?
He's probably a LEGO employee.

No, I'm afraid I don't work for LEGO, and I found this thread after finding a review on it on youtube. My advice still stands though. But, hey, don't trust me, do a search on google and see for yourself. I'm sure there are hundreds of listings of copyright lawsuits that would show one way or the other.
